forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly cloudy, with a low around 54. West southwest wind around 16 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly sunny, with a high near 62. West southwest wind 10 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
As the dawn attempts to break through a veil of clouds, Downtown San Francisco rests in a gentle embrace of coolness, the morning air fragrant with the promise of the day ahead. The sky hangs low, mostly cloudy, whispering tales of the marine layer that lingers, maybe teasing with hints of illumination beneath the gray. A brisk wind nudges through the streets, a reminder of the natural elements at play, providing a refreshing kiss that might seem invigorating or a touch biting, depending on one's willingness to meet it head-on.

Looking ahead to Sunday, the city will gradually reveal its more inviting countenance; by mid-afternoon, the sun will pierce through the clouds, casting its warm gaze upon the iconic skyline. Expect a pleasant high near 62, perfect for roaming the quaint streets or savoring a cup of coffee in one of the city's many charming cafes. Yet, as the winds stir—the west southwest zephyr promises to keep the air lively, gusts reaching up to 26 mph—one might consider layering lightly, perhaps opting for a light jacket or a cozy sweater. 

Such weather invites the spirit of exploration, whether that means strolling along the Embarcadero, finding refuge beneath the shady branches of a park, or indulging in a leisurely read at a favorite spot. There’s a demeanor of ease in the air, a perfect time to lose oneself in simple joys, making memories that you’ll carry with you long after the day has faded into evening.
